message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with optimization of user pairing and beamforming design in a downlink non-orthogonal multiple access (NOMA) network to maximize the minimum rate among all users. This problem involves signal processing, communication theory, and optimization, which are all covered by the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-categories. The paper also proposes a sequential convex approximation method to solve the mixed-integer nonconvex optimization problem, which falls under the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. Additionally, the paper presents numerical results to compare the proposed method with traditional beamforming solutions, which involves machine learning (cs.MM) and Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories.
